;;美国国防部提供的视频中的图片显示了中国飞机拦截美国战机的情况。五角大楼公布了中国飞机拦截美国战机的视频。
;

;美国指责中国在国际空域策划对美国军机进行危险和挑衅性空军演习，并警告中国可能会在无意中引发两国之间的冲突。

;

;五角大楼表示，中国飞机的攻击性战术对飞越东海和南海地区的美国飞机构成了威胁，自 2021 年秋季以来，此类事件已发生超过 180 起。

;

; >;

;“在近 200 起案件中，（中国）操作员......发射箔条或发射照明弹或过快或靠近美国飞机，”负责印度-太平洋安全事务的助理国防部长伊利·拉特纳 (Ely Ratner) 表示。;

;

;;相关：;;美国和中国正处于碰撞之中，可能会引发冲突|努里埃尔·鲁比尼;

;
;

;“过去两年比之前十年还要多，”他补充道。

;

;美中关系;处于多年来的最低点;，在贸易、人权、台湾和南海等一系列问题上关系紧张。

;

;“这种操作行为可能会导致事故，而危险的事故可能会导致无意的冲突，”拉特纳说，并补充说，自 2021 年秋季以来统计的事件数量，如果算上美国的盟友，则增加到近 300 起。

;

;拉特纳声称，北京方面有意“进行这些危险行为，以便拉特纳说，在一个例子中，一架中国战斗机“以每小时数百英里的速度接近我们的资产，明显武装起来，距离只有 30 英尺”离开”，并在那里呆了超过15分钟。

; ;

;周二的新闻发布会召开之前，白宫曾在夏季发出警告，;中国在海上和空中的军事侵略性;导致险些相撞，并可能很快导致人员伤亡。

; < p>;“用不了多久就会有人受伤，”国家安全委员会发言人约翰·柯比 (John Kirby) 6 月对记者表示。

;

;美国周二发出警告之际，加拿大单独指责北京的战斗机“鲁莽” ” 拦截加拿大海上巡逻机。据飞行中的加拿大电视台工作人员称，中国飞机跟踪极光号飞机长达几个小时，其任务是执行联合国对朝鲜的制裁。

;

;其中一架飞机距离加拿大飞机不到 5 米。加拿大国防部长比尔·布莱尔称这一举动“不专业”。

;

;周二，北京予以回击，指责这架飞机“非法侵入赤尾岛领空”，赤尾岛位于日本管辖的尖阁列岛内。中国。

;

;“加拿大军机不远万里到中国家门口寻衅滋事，”外交部发言人毛宁表示。 “中方依法依规处理。”

;

;在指责中国干预加拿大选举以及试图恐吓议员导致议员被驱逐后，今年加中关系再创新低5月的中国外交官。

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 11:22:01 +0800 X, formerly Twitter, rolls out US$1 annual fee for new users in New Zealand and the Philippineshttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/oct/18/x-twitter-1-dollar-annual-subscription-fee-new-users-elon-musk-new-zealand-nz-philippines
;;2023-10-18T02:31:54Z;
;
;;在 Twitter 品牌重塑后，社交媒体平台 X 的徽标覆盖了该插图中的旧徽标< /div>;

;X（前身为 Twitter）平台已开始向新西兰和菲律宾的新用户收取 1 美元的年费，埃隆·马斯克 (Elon Musk) 旗下的该服务公司称此举旨在打击机器人。< /p>;

;《财富》;首次报道订阅计划;，每年花费 1 美元即可访问关键功能，包括发推、回复、转发和点赞。 《财富》杂志报道后，;X 透露了详细信息;。

;

;“作为2023 年 10 月 17 日，我们开始测试“Not A Bot”，这是一种针对两个国家新用户的新订阅方法，”该公司在一篇帖子中表示。 “这项新测试的开发是为了加强我们在减少垃圾邮件、平台操纵和机器人活动方面所做的巨大努力。

;
;

;;相关：;;埃隆·马斯克表示 Twitter（现在是 X）可以向所有用户收取订阅费;

;
;

;“这将评估一种潜在的强大措施，帮助我们打击 X 上的机器人和垃圾邮件发送者，同时平衡平台的可访问性和少量费用。在此次测试中，现有用户不受影响。”

;

;在新西兰和菲律宾创建的新帐户将首先需要验证其电话号码，然后支付 1 美元年费才能发帖、点赞、回复、转发、引用帖子和书签。

;

;“选择退出订阅的新用户将只能执行“只读”操作，例如：阅读帖子、观看视频和关注X 在帖子中表示。

;

;价格大约为 1.43 新西兰元和 42.51 菲律宾比索。

;

;“这个新计划旨在防御机器人和垃圾邮件发送者。操纵平台并扰乱其他 X 用户的体验。我们期待尽快分享更多有关结果的信息。”该帖子称。

;

;条款和条件称，新收费是一个测试计划，注册的用户必须同意定期订阅付款。< /p>;

;马斯克;首先标记了上个月与以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡交谈时，有可能向所有用户收费，但目前的计划仅限于新用户。

;

;他说，逻辑是机器人成本“ ”设置的一小部分”，并将帐户成本提高到“几美元或其他东西”可能会让软件操作员望而却步。

;

;“此外，每次机器人创建者想要制造另一个机器人，他们就需要另一种新的支付方式，”他说。

;

;自从马斯克实施了 X 高级蓝色勾号产品以来，该产品在美国的 iPhone 每月售价 11 美元，在英国每月 11 英镑， 19 澳元，该产品;并没有阻止诈骗者使用X 高级帐户;，以定位平台上的用户。

;

;向新用户收费的举动是因为马斯克看到了广告之外的其他收入途径，并推动 X 成为“一切”应用程序 –包括支付服务。

;

;马斯克表示，自他接手以来，广告商的抵制以及对其管理不当或仇恨内容的担忧导致广告收入下降了 60%。

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 10:52:02 +0800 ‘Horrific’: 189 bodies found and removed from Colorado ‘green’ funeral homehttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/17/colorado-funeral-home-decaying-bodies-found
;;2023-10-18T01:19:01Z;
;
;;10 月 6 日，科罗拉多州彭罗斯关闭的殡仪馆门口散落着用过的防护服。
;< p>;官方周二表示，科罗拉多州一家殡仪馆发现并移走了至少 189 具腐烂尸体，而两周前发现尸体时报告的尸体数量约为 115 具。

;

;这些遗骸是由科罗拉多州彭罗斯小镇一栋破旧建筑内的“回归自然”殡仪馆散发出恶臭气味，当局对此作出回应。

;
;

;;相关：;;科罗拉多州“绿色”殡仪馆发现至少 115 具尸体;

;
;

;在联邦调查局团队的帮助下，上周开始了对遗骸的识别工作，该团队被部署到处理空难等大规模伤亡事件中。弗里蒙特警长艾伦·库珀形容这一场景“可怕”。

;

;这一发现是在“回归自然”殡仪馆的业主近几个月未能缴纳税款、被逐出其一处房产并因未缴税款而被起诉之后发生的。大约一年前停止与他们开展业务的火葬场收到了账单。

;

;在报告恶臭后的第二天，殡仪馆和火葬场登记办公室主任与业主乔恩通了电话霍尔福德。根据州官员 10 月 5 日的命令，他承认彭罗斯遗址存在“问题”，并声称他在那里进行动物标本剥制术。

;

;当局因“令人厌恶的气味”进入殡仪馆被忽视的建筑而做出反应。 10 月 4 日，根据搜查令，发现了腐烂的尸体。

;

;联系 Hallford 和他的妻子 Carie 以及回归自然的尝试均未成功。多条发给殡仪馆寻求评论的短信都没有得到回复。没有人接听商务电话，也没有人回复周二留下的语音留言。

;

;该公司提供火葬和不使用防腐液的“绿色”埋葬服务，但随着问题的加剧，该公司仍在继续开展业务。

;

;根据科罗拉多州法律，绿色埋葬是合法的，但州法规要求任何未在 24 小时内埋葬的尸体都必须适当冷藏。

;

;科罗拉多州对殡仪馆的规定是全国最弱的，没有常规规定殡仪馆经营者的检查或资质要求。

;

;截至上周，已有 120 多个家庭担心自己的亲属可能在遗体中，就此​​事联系了执法部门。

;

;埃尔帕索县验尸官莱昂·凯利表示，可能需要数周时间才能辨认发现的遗骸。

;

;直到彭罗斯殡仪馆注册到期十多个月后，没有迹象表明州监管机构访问了该地点或联系了霍尔福德。去年，州立法者授权监管机构在未经业主同意的情况下检查殡仪馆，但没有提供额外资金来加强检查。

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 09:22:02 +0800 Carla Bley, imaginative jazz pianist and composer, dies aged 87https://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/oct/18/carla-bley-dead-aged-87-jazz-pianist-composer-dies
;;2023-10-17T22:56:50Z;
;
;;卡拉·布莱 (Carla Bley) 摄于 2006 年。
;

;卡拉·布莱 (Carla Bley)，美国爵士作曲家兼钢琴家，因大胆前卫的作品以及她对这一流派主流的令人振奋和美丽的看法，已经去世，享年 87 岁。脑癌。

;

;Bley 顽皮、愉快但尖锐的创作方式意味着她录制的爵士乐作品涵盖了整个爵士乐谱系，从简单可爱的钢琴曲（《Lawns》等曲成为流媒体服务的标准和热门歌曲）到尖锐的政治作品大型乐队的作品和广受好评的 1973 年三张唱片爵士摇滚歌剧《山上的自动扶梯》，配角包括乡村流行歌手琳达·朗斯塔特、奶油贝斯手杰克·布鲁斯和曼弗雷德·曼的保罗·琼斯。

;
; < p>;;相关：;;《Carla Bley Trio：Life Goes On》评论 - 温暖、充满活力，甚至有趣;

;
;

;据她了解，Lovella May Borg 1936 年出生于加利福尼亚州奥克兰他从三岁开始学习钢琴，但在 14 岁时辍学，并在湾区爵士俱乐部担任钢琴家。布莱 (Bley) 17 岁时搬到纽约，在爵士俱乐部 Birdland 担任香烟女郎，后来说：“我是那个在餐桌上给你和你女朋友拍照片的人，以纪念你们和一个不在场的人在一起。”通常是你的妻子。我几乎没有卖出任何东西，因为我在听音乐，”其中包括迈尔斯·戴维斯、约翰·科尔特兰、贝西伯爵等。

; ;

;她遇到了钢琴家保罗·布莱 (Paul Bley)，并于 1957 年与他结婚，并一起搬回加利福尼亚，布莱为他和洛杉矶乐队即兴创作音乐，其成员包括奥内特·科尔曼 (Ornette Coleman) 和唐·切里 (Don Cherry)。

;

;布莱斯回到纽约，卡拉深入参与了这座城市的自由爵士乐场景：“我想尽可能多地反对爵士乐世界中错误的事情，并改变音乐世界中存在的整个体系。”她后来解释道。

;

;她是爵士作曲家管弦乐团及其附属协会的重要组成部分，该协会是一个代表音乐家工作条件的工会。同样具有政治头脑的是解放音乐乐团，由贝斯手查理·哈登指挥，他的灵感来自于西班牙内战歌曲、切·格瓦拉等歌曲——布莱是该乐团的编曲者和指挥，《滚石》杂志的莱斯特·邦斯称赞她在《音乐》中的“动态奇迹”。对他们 1970 年同名专辑的评论。

;

;在被披头士乐队迷住后，Bley 还探索了流行音乐和摇滚乐的融合。除了与大约 50 名人员一起历时五年录制《Escalator Over the Hill》之外，她还为 Pink Floyd 乐队 Nick Mason 的首张专辑创作了音乐，并与 Robert Wyatt 合作。与 Bley 友好离婚（并保留他的姓氏）后，她还与第二任丈夫、小号手 Michael Mantler 进行了许多 20 世纪 70 年代的合作；这对夫妇还有一个女儿凯伦。

;

;她继续与哈登的解放音乐乐团重新建立联系（并在 2014 年哈登去世后执掌该乐团），并与她自己的同名大乐队合作。从 20 世纪 70 年代末开始，她与德国唱片公司 ECM 一起发行了源源不断的个人专辑，其中与 Swallow 和萨克斯管演奏家 Andy Sheppard 合作的三重奏专辑达到了顶峰，最近;2020 年生活仍将继续;。

; ;

;她于 2018 年被诊断出患有脑癌，解释道：“有时我不知道问题的答案，所以我认为他们一定是误删了一些东西，因为自从手术后我就不再拥有完美的音高了。”

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 07:22:01 +0800 House remains without speaker as Jim Jordan falls short of votes in first ballothttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/17/house-speaker-vote-jim-jordan-republicans
;;2023-10-17T21:46:55Z;
;
;;吉姆·乔丹带着肖像走下大厅
;

;众议院无法选出新的本月早些时候，共和党人凯文·麦卡锡历史性地被赶下台，俄亥俄州的极右翼国会议员吉姆·乔丹 (Jim Jordan) 艰难地赢得了木槌。

;

;在第一轮投票中，20 名共和党人反对乔丹。 ，而200名共和党人支持司法委员会主席。这一结果使乔丹距离赢得议长职位还很遥远，因为他只能承担会议中四次叛逃的后果，但仍能夺取议长权。全部 212 名众议院民主党人都支持纽约州的哈基姆·杰弗里斯，使这位民主党领袖的票数超过了乔丹。

;

;投票后对记者发表讲话时，乔丹最初表示共和党人将在周二晚上举行另一次投票，但该计划被推迟了。由于乔丹的批评者加倍反对，这项计划被取消。众议院将于周三上午 11 点重新开会，开始下一轮投票，但目前尚不清楚乔丹是否有获胜之路。

;

;对于乔丹来说，这是一个令人担忧的迹象，他的一些批评者，;由佛罗里达州国会议员马里奥·迪亚兹-巴拉特(Mario Díaz-Balart)领导，呼吁周二立即进行第二次投票，这可能表明他们相信自己的队伍正在壮大。在第一次投票失败后，乔丹至少赢得了一位新的支持者，即加利福尼亚州国会议员道格·拉马尔法，但这仍然使他未能获得多数席位。

;

;这次僵局标志着众议院自 1923 年以来第二次陷入僵局。需要不止一张选票来选举发言人；最近的另一场僵局发生在 1 月份，当时麦卡锡需要 15 轮投票才能赢得最高职位。

;

;众议院现已两周没有发言人，导致众议院陷入瘫痪。尽管两党许多议员都强调在最近的; ;哈马斯袭击事件后迫切需要批准对以色列的一揽子援助计划，但众议院仍然无法通过任何立法。

;

;主席众议院共和党会议的代表、纽约州的埃莉斯·斯特凡尼克(Elise Stefanik)在周二拉开了会议序幕，正式提名乔丹并鼓励她的同事支持他。她庆祝乔丹，他是;最著名的人;表彰他过去与领导层的冲突以及他对唐纳德·特朗普的坚定支持，作为“赢得最艰难战斗的美国第一战士”。

;

;“我们正处于美国面临巨大危机的时刻，这个会议厅正面临历史性挑战，”斯特凡尼克说。 “我想起以斯帖记：‘在这样的时刻’。吉姆·乔丹将在这样的时刻担任美国议长。”

;

;众议院民主党核心小组主席、加州众议员皮特·阿吉拉尔随后提名少数党领袖哈基姆·杰弗里斯担任议长，他警告说约旦的崛起将代表着对“极端主义”的危险让步。

;

;“今天的投票选举全国堕胎禁令的设计者、公开选举的否认者和叛乱煽动者将成为众议院议长阿吉拉尔说：“这给国家和我们的盟友带来了可怕的信息。”

;
;

;;相关：;;吉姆·乔丹：极右派的宠儿，违抗了 1 月 6 日的传票;

;
;

; 周五，在众议院多数党鞭、路易斯安那州的史蒂夫·斯卡利斯因极右翼议员的反对而被迫退出竞选后，乔丹赢得了共和党会议的议长提名。乔丹在第一次会议投票中落后于斯卡利斯，在第二次尝试中获得了提名，以 124 比 81 击败了佐治亚州的共和党同胞奥斯汀·斯科特。

;

;尽管他获得了提名，但乔丹的支持率远远低于他周二赢得议长职位所需的 217 票。下午 1 点开始进行全体投票，目前尚不清楚乔丹是否说服了足够多的批评者成为发言人。包括内布拉斯加州的唐·培根和迈克·劳勒在内的一些较为温和的共和党人继续坚称他们不会支持乔丹，并在第一轮投票中投票反对会议的提名人。

;

;“我不是周一晚上，培根在 X（以前称为 Twitter）上说道。 “我曾五次担任指挥官，四次被部署到中东。我会做对国家最有利的事情。”

;

;在周二会议开始之前，乔丹;表示; 共和党人将继续投票，直到选出新的领导人，这可能会导致另一场漫长的议长选举。但在第一次投票未能产生结果后，代理议长、北卡罗来纳州共和党人帕特里克·麦克亨利宣布众议院休会。几个小时后，乔丹告诉记者，共和党将于周三重新开会恢复投票。

;

;

;如果乔丹能够赢得议长职位，民主党人似乎准备用他的胜利作为极端主义的例子，他们认为极端主义已经超越了美国共和党。众议院民主党筹款部门民主党国会竞选委员会已向成员分发了一份备忘录，鼓励他们强调乔丹的立法记录，包括他投票推翻 2020 年总统选举结果。

;

;“议长乔丹意味着极端主义和极右翼优先事项将主导众议院，”备忘录写道。 “我们的核心小组必须向选民表明国会议员乔丹有多极端。”

;
;;肯·麦卡勒姆与五眼联盟的其他情报负责人出席联邦调查局在加利福尼亚州主办的峰会。
;

;军情五处负责人表示，中国国家行为者在 LinkedIn 上与估计 20,000 名英国人接触，希望窃取工业或技术机密。

;

;肯·麦卡勒姆 (Ken McCallum) 表示，工业间谍活动正在“发生”真实规模”，他估计 10,000 家英国企业面临风险，特别是在中国试图取得进展的人工智能、量子计算或合成生物学领域。

;

;“每周，我们的团队都会发现大量军情五处总干事在联邦调查局在加利福尼亚州主办的五眼联盟国内间谍负责人峰会前表示，“特别是中国等国家以及俄罗斯和伊朗等国家进行了大量的秘密活动。”

;

;“活动不仅仅针对政府或军事机密。甚至不仅仅是针对我们的关键基础设施，而是越来越多地针对有前途的初创公司——从我们的大学、学术研究本身以及那些可能不认为国家安全与他们有关的人们中衍生出来的创新公司。”

;

;A麦卡勒姆表示，主要的攻击媒介是试图窃取在 LinkedIn 上冒充招聘顾问的中国行为者的信息。他说：“我们认为，通过此类网站在网上进行初步处理的案件已经超过 20,000 起，”而两年半前这一数字为 10,000 起。

;

;对中国工业间谍活动的担忧已经增加在过去十年中，以美国为首的经济急剧上升，美国的情报和军事机构认为他们的国家陷入了争夺未来经济秩序主导地位的长期斗争中。

;

;联邦调查局局长克里斯托弗·雷 (Christopher Wray)，将中国共产党描述为“对创新的头号威胁”，并指责北京将“经济间谍活动和窃取他人的工作和思想作为其国家战略的核心组成部分”。

;

;他说他正在竞选与中国活动有关的“远远超过约 2,000 项调查”，并且他的机构“大约每 12 小时”打开一个新的案件档案。

;

;麦卡勒姆没有为军情五处提供任何同等数据，但该机构此前曾表示，其在中国的案件数量在过去四年中增加了七倍。

;

;周二，该机构表示，其了解到有 20 起中国公司考虑或寻求使用“模糊投资、富有想象力的公司”的案例。细节很少，但军情五处表示，它知道至少有两家中国公司试图找出法律漏洞来获取英国公司和大学开发的技术。英国公司的敏感技术未被发现，另一家中国公司获取了从英国顶尖大学窃取的研究数据。

;

;英国从未因为北京从事间谍活动而被起诉。今年早些时候，一名威斯敏斯特议会研究员因涉嫌违反旧的官方机密立法而被捕，他正在等待是否会受到指控。

;

;麦卡勒姆表示，他预计新的国家安全法案将成为法律this year with updated definitions of espionage, would lead to Chinese agents being tried in British courts, similar to how terrorists are prosecuted.

;

;“As we proceed further, you would expect to see our police, the Crown Prosecution Service and the courts will more often draw relevance to state threats' work in the way that is entirely routine on our counter-terrorism work,” he said.

;

;The five agency heads were due to meet with representatives of the technology sector later on Tuesday at Stanford University in order to pass on their warnings, after appearing in public together for the first time at a roundtable event in the morning chaired by the former US secretary of state Condoleezza Rice.

;

;Five Eyes members include intelligence agencies from Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the UK and US.

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 03:22:02 +0800 Killing of two Swedish football fans in Brussels ‘probably lone wolf’ attackhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/17/killing-of-two-swedes-in-brussels-probably-lone-wolf-attack
;;2023-10-17T18:20:22Z;
;
;;Flowers are place at the scene where two football supporters from Sweden were shot dead in Brussels, Belgium.
;

;A Tunisian man who killed two Swedish citizens in a terrorist attack in Brussels was “probably a lone wolf,” the Belgian prime minister has said, as Sweden and Italy called for security at Europe's borders to be tightened.

;

;Sweden's prime minister said the country was suffering “unfathomable sadness” after the fatal shooting of two Swedish football fans, one in his 60s and one in his 70s, and the wounding of a taxi driver.

;

;Speaking before a planned visit to Brussels on Wednesday to take part in a memorial ceremony, Ulf Kristersson warned that it was time for Europe to bolster security. “This is a time for more security; we can't be naive,” he said.

;

;“We have an openness in Europe, which is one of the important reasons why we need to keep an eye on the EU's external border, because otherwise people can easily move between European countries,” he added.

;

;“These terrorists want to scare us into obedience and silence. That will not happen.”

;

;The suspected assailant, identified in reports as Abdesalem Lassoued, 45, used an automatic rifle on Monday night to shoot dead the two men and injure the third before fleeing the scene on a scooter. He was himself ;shot dead; on Tuesday morning by police outside a cafe in the Schaerbeek area near Brussels city centre.

; ;

;Investigators said the suspect had claimed in a video on social media that he was a fighter “for Allah,” prompting concern over a potential wave of radicalisation triggered by the war between Israel and Hamas.

;

;The prosecutor's office, which had initially said there was no evidence that the attack was related to the conflict, said on Tuesday that such a link was being explored.

;

;“We initially said that there would be no connection with the events in Gaza, but we have since established that he has shared a number of expressions of support for the Palestinian people on his social media,” said Eric Van Der Sypt of the federal prosecutor's office. “So this may have played a role.”

;

;The public prosecutor's office said “all possible avenues” were being investigated. “The investigation will have to reveal his precise motives,” it said.

;

;Belgium is still haunted by terrorist attacks in 2016 that killed 32 people and injured more than 300. But investigations are understood so far to have not shown any links between the gunman and other groups, or any evidence of a terrorist cell operating in Belgium.

;

;Speaking at a press conference, the Belgian prime minister, Alexander De Croo, said the security threat level for Brussels had in fact been reduced to level 3 from level 4 after the fatal shooting of the attacker.

;

;“We managed to neutralise the guilty person. So there was no longer any imminent threat,” De Croo said, adding he was “probably a lone wolf, but we cannot rule out copycat behaviour”.

;

;However the level 3 threat level, which has not been in force for more than five years, indicates that terrorist acts are “possible and probable” with extra security deployed to secure certain areas and institutions such as the EU headquarters.

;

;It emerged on Tuesday that Lassoued had arrived in Italy's Lampedusa island in 2011 and then moved to Sweden from where he was deported following a spell in prison, the Swedish migration agency said. He is then believed to have returned to Italy, where he was identified by police in Bologna in 2016 as a “radicalised subject” who was also monitored by intelligence services.

;

;The man then moved to Belgium.

;

;The Belgian justice minister, Vincent Van Quickenborne, confirmed the perpetrator “was on the radar of the security services” for illegal residence and four other matters but not on the country's list of potential terrorists. He had no criminal record, he added.

;

;The gunman's background looks likely to reignite debate about migration to the EU. Italy's interior minister called on Brussels to speed up the implementation of the controversial deal it did with Tunisia to reduce people smuggling across the Mediterranean.

;

;Speaking on Tuesday, Kristersson expressed particular concern for Swedish citizens. “All indications are that this is a terror attack aimed at Sweden and Swedish citizens only due to them being Swedish,” he said.

;

;His thoughts were with the “innocent people who have died”, the injured man and their relatives, as well as Sweden fans in the stadium who had travelled to Belgium for the Euro 2024 qualifying football match between Belgium and Sweden.; ;The flag outside the Swedish parliament was flown at half mast on Tuesday.

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 02:52:01 +0800 Russian sources disappeared after Trump declassified ex-spy’s evidence, UK court toldhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/17/russian-sources-disappeared-after-trump-declassified-ex-spys-evidence-uk-court-told

;
;;Christopher Steele (centre) walking ahead of two other people, one of whom is holding a cardboard document box
;

;Donald Trump's decision to declassify evidence given by a former British spy about the former US president's alleged links with Russia led to the disappearance of two Russian sources, according to a court document.

;

;Christopher Steele, who used to run MI6's Russia desk, compiled the notorious ;“Steele dossier”; investigating Trump's connections to Russia. In a witness statement released on Tuesday, Steele said publication of his testimony to the ;Mueller investigation on the matter;, originally classified secret, was an “egregious and reckless act” that “served no purpose other than to expose me and Orbis [Steele's company], our sources and our methods”.

;

;Trump is ;attempting to sue; Orbis Business Intelligence in England over the dossier, which alleged that he engaged in “perverted sexual behaviour” and paid bribes to Russian officials to further his business interests. The former president is claiming breach of his data protection rights and says the dossier's claims against him were “false” and “phoney” and caused him reputational damage and distress.

;

;In his witness statement, Steele said the decision to declassify his testimony, taken on Trump's last day in office, resulted in several Russian sources being exposed and suffering “varying consequences”.

;

;He said: “Two of the named Russian sources have not been seen or heard of since. The publication of this document did serious damage to the US government's Russian operations and their ability to recruit new Russian sources. The claimant's [Trump's] actions in this regard were truly shocking and arguably constitute one of the most egregious breaches of intelligence rules and protocol by the US government in recent times.”

;

;The statement was released a day after a hearing at the high court, the result of which will determine whether Trump can proceed with his case against Orbis, which Steele co-founded.

;

;In his witness statement released on Monday, Trump said bringing the lawsuit against Orbis was “the only way that I can fully demonstrate the total inaccuracies of the personal data in the dossier”. The dossier was published by BuzzFeed in 2017 but Trump accepts Orbis was not legally responsible for this and is suing over the company's dissemination of it to three individuals.

;

;Orbis, which is seeking to have the claim struck out before it goes to trial, argues it has been brought too late and for the “illegitimate” purpose “of harassing Orbis and Mr Steele and pursuing longstanding grievances”.

;

;In his witness statement, Steele suggested Trump's discovery of Steele's friendship with Trump's daughter Ivanka had damaged their father-daughter relationship, “deepened his animus towards me, and [it] is one of the reasons for his vindictive and vexatious conduct towards me and Orbis”.

;

;In his witness statement, Trump said Ivanka was “completely irrelevant” to the case, adding: “Any inference or allegation that Mr Steele makes about my relationship with my daughter is untrue and disgraceful.”

;

;Orbis also argues that any damage to Trump was done by the BuzzFeed publication, for which it was not responsible, and highlights that Trump's declassification of the Mueller investigation records led “to further public consideration of its [the dossier's] contents”.

;

;Robert Mueller's ;report on Russian interference; in the 2016 presidential election made clear that the Trump campaign was “receptive” to offers of assistance from the Russians but it did not find evidence of a criminal conspiracy.

;

;The judge's decision on whether Trump's case against Orbis can go to trial will be made at a later date.

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 02:52:01 +0800 Hot stuff: Pepper X is named world’s spiciest by Guinness World Recordshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/17/pepper-x-spiciest-guinness-world-records
;;2023-10-17T18:10:34Z;
;
;;Ed Currie holds up one of his Pepper X peppers in Fort Mill, South Carolina.
;

;A new pepper is coming in hot as the spiciest in the world, Guinness World Records has ;announced;.

;

;For a decade, the ;Carolina Reaper; chilli pepper was ruled to be the hottest chilli pepper in the world. But now “Pepper X” has taken its crown.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Canadian breaks speed record for eating 50 Carolina reapers;

;
;

;The spiciness of a pepper is measured on what is known as the ;Scoville scale;, which was established by the pharmacist Wilbur Scoville in 1912. The scale measures the concentration of capsaicin, the primary component of a pepper that makes it spicy.

;

;Capsaicin “causes a burning sensation when it makes contact with human tissue”, according to Guinness World Records.

;

;Pepper X measures 2.69m heat units on the Scoville scale. That beats the Carolina Reaper chilli pepper by over 1m units, laboratory tests conducted at South Carolina's Winthrop University in August showed.

;

;Both Pepper X and the Carolina Reaper were created by the renowned pepper breeder appropriately named Ed Currie. The man whose last name is phonetically identical to the often spicy dish called Pepper X's new title “a team effort”.

; ;

;In order to create Pepper X, Currie crossbred the Carolina Reaper with a pepper his friend sent him from Michigan that was “brutally hot”.

;

;Only five people – including Currie – had tasted Pepper X when its record-breaking status was announced on Monday.

;

;Pepper X was ;revealed; in the popular YouTube show Hot Ones. The show's creator and host Sean Evans tries chicken wings of varying heat levels with celebrity guests such as the actor Jennifer Lawrence, the chef Gordon Ramsay, the singer Billie Eilish, the basketball champion Shaquille O'Neal and the musician Dave Grohl.

;

;“When we bred this pepper out, first thing we looked for is something to raise that heat level to what we thought was going to be the maximum, and the second thing was flavor,” Currie told Evans on the show.

;

;Consumers will be able to test Pepper X exclusively in the form of commercially sold hot sauce.

; ;

;Due to past experience, Currie intends to protect Pepper X more fiercely under his intellectual property. Therefore, he will not publicly release the pods and seeds of Pepper X.

;

;“People have been trying to steal [the Carolina Reaper pepper] for the last 10 years,” Currie said. “There are also some high corporations who want to take what's not theirs, and they're willing to pay other people to do it.

;

;“We have to protect ourselves. This is our pepper and we are going to take the world out with it.”

;

;Currie said he still felt the heat of the pepper more than three hours later and it left him with “horrible cramps”. Despite this, he said his pain was not in vain.

;

;“All the time and effort that we put in at the farm to make sure this got stabilized and became the hottest pepper in the world is now validated,” Curried said when awarded the record for hottest pepper. “I can't tell you how excited I am right now.”
